intro: Stroganowia subalpina, commonly known as the Alpine Stroganowia, is a rare flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible roots. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, often in areas with limited sunlight. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
